title: Is it just me, or is anyone else getting massive lag in games as of about a week ago?
body: I used to have a solid static 30 ping, and everything was fine, but about a week ago my ping shifted up to being about 40 with constant spikes from 200-500 and sometimes 1000 ping. Nothing has changed on my end, and my ping to my closest server is unchanged, so what happened?

replies.body:
There are a lot of things that could have changed between your PC and our servers, mostly on your ISP's or their partner networks' infrastructure. In order to confirm all your local settings are fine, I'd like you to take a peek at our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) and ensure your network settings are compatible.

If you continue to experience issues with your latency in-game after working through those steps, let me know os we can further troubleshoot.

My ping spikes have worsened to the degree that i disconnect multiple times a game. It's inexplicable to me. I mean there hasnt been any changes to any of my devices for a significant amount of time, so i really can't find anything wrong on my end.
Rogers has been having issues the past couple of weeks and today it's basically gotten insanely bad (since around noon).  It's definitely an ISP related problem tho.

Alright, great. At least now I know I'm definitely not the source of the problem.
I guess I'll need to check on when these issues will be fixed then.

I had done most of these before but it didn't change anything, so i went and tried the other few. Nothing. I think something my internet service provider has done is causing a problem connecting to your servers, as it seems other devices and applications are running slower than normal as well on my internet. Hopefully I can find the problem there before too long (assuming there is one).
